pull.title: contrib: fix manpage generation
pull.body: 0972f5504021b482b27523fd3bcb8036cf6b439c from #33229 broke manpage generation, because the assumption that the last word in the line containing the version number, was the version number, no-longer holds for some binaries. i.e `bitcoind`.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33996. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [janb84](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33996#pullrequestreview-3534282452), [rkrux](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33996#pullrequestreview-3534323387) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore.

tACK 10e6417b3b33a7df18a61d657153f3d90b89dbf2

The regex seems a little loose but ok.

ACK 10e6417b3b33a7df18a61d657153f3d90b89dbf2

This PR fixes gen-manpages to process the version in a different way.

Master, breaks: 
<details>

```sh
./contrib/devtools/gen-manpages.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/arjan/Projects/bitcoin/./contrib/devtools/gen-manpages.py", line 65, in <module>
    assert verstr.startswith('v')
           ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^
AssertionError
```
</details>

This PR, works:
<details>

```sh
 ./contrib/devtools/gen-manpages.py
Generating /Users/jan/Projects/bitcoin/doc/man/bitcoin.1â€¦
Generating /Users/jan/Projects/bitcoin/doc/man/bitcoind.1â€¦
Generating /Users/jan/Projects/bitcoin/doc/man/bitcoin-cli.1â€¦
Generating /Users/jan/Projects/bitcoin/doc/man/bitcoin-tx.1â€¦
Generating /Users/jan/Projects/bitcoin/doc/man/bitcoin-wallet.1â€¦
Generating /Users/jan/Projects/bitcoin/doc/man/bitcoin-util.1â€¦
Generating /Users/jan/Projects/bitcoin/doc/man/bitcoin-qt.1â€¦
```
</details>

Version is also picked up correctly: 
<details>

```md
.TH BITCOIND "1" "January 1980" "bitcoind v30.99.0-10e6417b3b33" "User Commands"
.SH NAME
bitcoind \- manual page for bitcoind v30.99.0-10e6417b3b33
```
> note: the date is local issue, not an error in the script.

</details>

tree 15b5dd9f78d9c9d9c5c4c2e0ea4f8251240f9f6b
parent bcf794d5f35b3210861d82b761b13d3ed9df14be
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1764687628 +0000
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1764756654 +0000

contrib: fix manpage generation

0972f5504021b482b27523fd3bcb8036cf6b439c from #33229 broke manpage
generation, because the assumption that the last word in the line
containing the version number, was the version number, no-longer holds
for some binaries. i.e bitcoind.

events.message:
contrib: fix manpage generation

0972f5504021b482b27523fd3bcb8036cf6b439c from #33229 broke manpage
generation, because the assumption that the last word in the line
containing the version number, was the version number, no-longer holds
for some binaries. i.e bitcoind.

events.body:
re ACK e9536faaee2bdb53807aa7c48aafa269d18f19d3

changes since last ack: 
- regex is now in raw string format.

(thanks for incorporating my nit)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -59,10 +60,11 @@
             print(f'{abspath} not found or not an executable', file=sys.stderr)
             sys.exit(1)
     # take first line (which must contain version)
-    verstr = r.stdout.splitlines()[0]
-    # last word of line is the actual version e.g. v22.99.0-5c6b3d5b3508
-    verstr = verstr.split()[-1]
-    assert verstr.startswith('v')
+    output = r.stdout.splitlines()[0]
+    # find the version e.g. v30.99.0-ce771726f3e7
+    search = re.search("v[0-9]\\S+", output)
comments.body:
Non-blocking NIT: maybe use raw strings version of regex for clarity and following [best practices](https://mimo.org/glossary/python/regex-regular-expressions) 

```suggestion
    search = re.search(r"v[0-9]\S+", output)
```

comments.diff_hunk:

             sys.exit(1)

-    verstr = r.stdout.splitlines()[0]
-    # last word of line is the actual version e.g. v22.99.0-5c6b3d5b3508
-    verstr = verstr.split()[-1]
-    assert verstr.startswith('v')
+    output = r.stdout.splitlines()[0]
+    # find the version e.g. v30.99.0-ce771726f3e7
+    search = re.search("v[0-9]\\S+", output)
